issue.title: Wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
Currently, the wind and waves plugins \(wamv\_gazebo\_wind\_plugin & wamv\_gazebo\_dynamics\_plugin respectively\) are model plugins \(attached to the wamv for VRX\). This was done as a way to lower required computation\(so the forces of the wind and waves are only calculated on the wamv\).

These plugins should be changed to world plugins for at least 3 reasons:

1. Wind/waves are not a property of the wamv, they are properties of the world.
2. With the current solution, a new wamv needs to be generated for each desired change in wind/wave conditions. This is messy.
3. The current solution has no expand ability for multiple model effects at the same time. ie: for the docking challenge we may want both the wamv and the dock to experience effects of the same wind and waves.

Desired outcome:

Wind and waves are both world plugins initiated by xacros with lists of models the wind and or waves will effect \(as well as parameters to describe the wind/waves\(currently all wind/waves number are hard coded\)\).

The plugins search the model list on every update until they have all the models included on the instantiation list. 

The plugins then apply the appropriate forces to the models.

These plugins should be changed to world plugins for at least 3 reasons:

  1. Wind/waves are not a property of the wamv, they are properties of the world.
  2. With the current solution, a new wamv needs to be generated for each desired change in wind/wave conditions. This is messy.
  3. The current solution has no expand ability for multiple model effects at the same time. ie: for the docking challenge we may want both the wamv and the dock to experience effects of the same wind and waves.

Desired outcome:

Wind and waves are both world plugins initiated by xacros with lists of models the wind and or waves will effect (as well as parameters to describe the wind/waves(currently all wind/waves number are hard coded)).

The plugins search the model list on every update until they have all the models included on the instantiation list.

The plugins then apply the appropriate forces to the models.
